@danigray @Mamaofabean @ThePeriodPurse @Ptbo_Canada I think your point was misstated then. I know you are not saying that “labels don’t matter” but rather what your post does covey is that labels matter (negatively) and we should avoid them/rethink them. I don’t agree with this assertion.

@danigray @Mamaofabean @ThePeriodPurse @Ptbo_Canada Suggesting labels “aren’t inclusive language” is your own veiled hang up. Labels can be both empowering and oppressive. I like this blog post much better as it does the subject of labels justice - minus the privilege lens. https://t.co/Yh5qE91r0B

@danigray @Mamaofabean @ThePeriodPurse @Ptbo_Canada I get what you attempted to say. But you did so by inferring labels were unnecessary. For some, labels form an important part of their identity. Next time instead of “my advice is to refrain from being so quick to give everything a label” maybe just save your advice & embrace.
RT @peopleosophy: So, saying put a cherry on top, stamped it and no change backs doesn’t work either? Aww man. #HRtweets #WellSaid 🍒🤯 https…

@danigray @Mamaofabean @ThePeriodPurse @Ptbo_Canada I see. So writing an entire blog post suggesting people need to drop labels (because it makes you uncomfy) is inclusive? Being inclusive means not telling anybody how to be / view themselves. Embracing them however they arrive is inclusivity. Know this.
This isn’t even a fair question. https://t.co/6Uzs8S1YnJ
Holy hell 5-year olds are SO EXTRA. 😐🔫 #ParentLife

@danigray @Mamaofabean @ThePeriodPurse @Ptbo_Canada To me, labeling is not the issue. Inclusivity means embracing it all regardless. If we have to remove labels in order to be inclusive / see people as human, then this is a problem. Let’s not be scared of labels people choose to use for themselves & focus instead on embracing.
